clinical_study.brief_title: Optimization of Nutritional Therapy in Mechanically Ventilated, Critically Ill Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: Optimization of Nutritional Therapy by Variation of Methods to Determine Energy Needs in Mechanically Ventilated, Critically Ill Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate whether an individualized determination of energy requirements using indirect calorimetry instead of a formula-based approach leads to an optimized nutritional support and as a consequence to an optimized nutritional status of the critically ill, mechanically ventilated patients measured by the phase angle.

primary_outcome.time_frame: PhA was measured between one and 90 days (during ICU stay)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the change of the phase angle during the stay in the intensive care unit (ICU). A mean difference of 5% is considered as relevant.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Nitrogen Balance was measured between one and 90 days (during ICU stay)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group between hospital admission and discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extracellular to body cell mass ratio (ECM/BCM - Ratio)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: ECM/BCM-Ratio was measured between one and 90 days (during ICU stay)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group between hospital admission and discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of hospital stay in days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Length of hospital stay was measured between one and 180 days
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group between hospital admission and discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in intensive care unit (ICU) in days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Length of ICU stay was measured between one and 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group between hospital admission and discharge.

arm_group.description: The energy need is being determined by using indirect calorimetry and if necessary, optimized by parenteral, enteral and additive parenteral nutrition.
This group receives nutrition supply according to the hospital routine ("standard care")

intervention.description: Energy need is being determined using indirect Calorimetry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age over 18 years
- mechanical ventilation
- an hospital stay of at least three days at the intensive care unit of the University Hospital of Tübingen
- possibility to perform indirect calorimetry measurements (FiO2 ≤70, PCO2 ≤ 0,5)
- possibility to perform Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA)
- underlying indication for enteral or/and parenteral nutritional support
- written informed consent from the patient or a legal authorized person
Exclusion Criteria:
- cardiac pacemaker
